meanings.definition: The quality of being easy to use or understand.
meanings.sent1: The usability of the new software impressed everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The website's usability made it simple for customers to navigate and find what they needed.
meanings.sent3: The usability of the puzzle was so good that even a child could solve it.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation had the usability of a well-written manual, making everything clear and easy to follow.
meanings.sent5: The usability of the remote control was so intuitive that even a technophobe could operate it.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is practical and user-friendly.
meanings.sent1: The usability of the new tool made the job much easier for the workers.
meanings.sent2: The usability of the app allowed users to complete tasks efficiently and without confusion.
meanings.sent3: The usability of the camping gear was so good that even a novice camper felt like a pro.
meanings.sent4: His idea had the usability of a Swiss Army knife, serving multiple purposes effectively.
meanings.sent5: The usability of the map was so clear that even someone with no sense of direction could navigate easily.
